pathway_info.title: Ang Alamat ng Materya: A Filipino Chemistry Adventure
pathway_info.description: Embark on a journey to uncover the secrets of chemistry right from your Filipino kitchen! This pathway transforms everyday items like 'suka', 'calamansi', and 'bigas' into tools for discovery. You will start with the basics of matter and progress to creating your own chemical reactions, all while connecting science to Filipino culture and cuisine.
unlocks: Advanced Chemistry: The Elements of Life
Environmental Science: Bayanihan for the Planet

quests.title: The Kitchen Alchemist's Pantry
quests.description: Your first quest is a scavenger hunt! Explore your kitchen and identify different types of matter. You will learn to classify common Filipino household items as solids, liquids, or gases and describe their physical properties.
learning_objectives: Identify the three states of matter: solid, liquid, gas.
Describe physical properties of substances (color, odor, texture).
Classify household materials based on their state of matter.
materials_needed: Various kitchen items (e.g., bigas/rice, asin/salt, toyo/soy sauce, suka/vinegar, water)
A pot to boil water (to observe steam)

quests.title: The Great Halo-Halo Separation
quests.description: Halo-halo is a delicious example of a mixture! In this quest, you'll learn the difference between homogeneous and heterogeneous mixtures by creating your own simple versions. You'll also practice basic separation techniques.
learning_objectives: Differentiate between homogeneous and heterogeneous mixtures.
Identify the components of a mixture.
Apply simple separation techniques like decantation and filtration.
materials_needed: Water, salt, sugar, sand or soil, small pebbles
A piece of cloth (katsa) or coffee filter for filtering

quests.title: The Secret of Sinigang: Acids and Bases
quests.description: Ever wonder what makes sinigang sour? It's acid! You'll create your own natural pH indicator from kamote (sweet potato) leaves or boiled red cabbage to test common household items and determine if they are acidic or basic.
learning_objectives: Understand the concept of acids and bases.
Create a natural pH indicator.
Test and classify household substances as acidic or basic.
Record observations in a structured table.
materials_needed: Kamote tops (talbos ng kamote) or red cabbage
Test substances: calamansi juice, suka (vinegar), baking soda solution, soap water

quests.title: The Changing of the Guard: Physical vs. Chemical
quests.description: From melting ice to frying an egg, changes are happening all around us. In this quest, you will perform simple experiments to understand the crucial difference between a physical change (form alters) and a chemical change (a new substance is formed).
learning_objectives: Distinguish between physical and chemical changes.
Identify evidence of a chemical change (e.g., gas production, color change).
Relate concepts to everyday cooking like frying a fish (pritong isda).
materials_needed: A small piece of paper (to tear and to burn with adult supervision)

quests.title: The Magic of Tawas: Solutions and Saturation
quests.description: Using 'tawas' (alum), a common item in many Filipino households, you'll dive into the world of solutions. You will learn what a saturated solution is and attempt to grow your own small crystals.
learning_objectives: Define solute, solvent, and solution.
Understand the concept of saturation.
Create a saturated solution and observe crystallization.
materials_needed: Tawas (alum powder), available at sari-sari stores or markets
Jar, string, and a pencil or stick

quests.title: The Atomic Abaniko
quests.description: All matter is made of tiny atoms! In this creative quest, you will use household items like bottle caps ('tansan') or pebbles to build models of simple molecules like water (H₂O) and carbon dioxide (CO₂). This will help you visualize the building blocks of everything around you.
learning_objectives: Understand that matter is made of atoms.
Differentiate between an atom and a molecule.
Construct 3D models of simple molecules.
materials_needed: Small, distinct items (e.g., different colored bottle caps, buttons, or pebbles)

quests.title: The Calamansi Concentration Challenge
quests.description: How sour is too sour? This quest is about concentration! You will make a series of calamansi juice solutions with varying strengths and use your algebra skills to calculate their concentration. You will analyze how concentration affects the acidity of the solution.
learning_objectives: Understand and calculate concentration (e.g., parts per 100mL).
Analyze how concentration affects a solution's properties (like acidity).
Practice systematic data collection and analysis.
materials_needed: Measuring cup (or a cup with markings)

quests.title: The 'Bulkang Pinatubo' Reaction
quests.description: Create your own mini volcano eruption! Using baking soda and vinegar, you will explore a classic chemical reaction. This time, you will focus on the amounts of reactants, introducing the idea that recipes in chemistry (chemical equations) matter.
learning_objectives: Observe a simple acid-base reaction.
Understand the concept of reactants and products.
Qualitatively explore how reactant ratios affect a reaction's outcome (introduction to stoichiometry).
materials_needed: A tray or basin to contain the 'lava'

quests.title: The Salty Solution Density Tower
quests.description: Connect chemistry and physics! In this quest, you will discover the concept of density by creating solutions with different salt concentrations. You will then carefully layer these solutions to build a beautiful, colorful density tower.
learning_objectives: Define density and understand how it relates to concentration.
Create solutions of varying densities.
Practice careful lab technique (layering liquids).

quests.title: My Filipino Kitchen Lab Report
quests.description: For your final quest, you are the lead scientist! Design your own experiment based on what you've learned. Ask a question, form a hypothesis, conduct the experiment using kitchen materials, and write a simple lab report to present your findings.
learning_objectives: Apply the full scientific method to a self-designed question.
Synthesize knowledge from all previous quests.
Communicate scientific findings clearly and concisely.
materials_needed: User's choice of common household materials

progression_analysis.recommended_focus: Pay close attention to measuring ingredients and recording your observations in tables or charts during each quest. This will significantly boost your Data Analysis skills, which are essential for any scientist.
